problem: James is planning a birthday party and wants to hang crepe-paper streamers from his backyard fence. His backyard fence is a rectangle that measures 20 feet on the long side and 15 feet on the short side. He also has a tree in the middle of the yard that is 10 feet tall, but he doesn't want to hang any streamers on the tree. How many feet of crepe paper does James need to buy for his fence?

history.name: Agent_Verifier
history.content: James is planning a birthday party and wants to hang crepe-paper streamers from his backyard fence. His backyard fence is a rectangle that measures 20 feet on the long side and 15 feet on the short side. He also has a tree in the middle of the yard that is 10 feet tall, but he doesn't want to hang any streamers on the tree. How many feet of crepe paper does James need to buy for his fence?

history.name: Agent_Problem_Solver
history.content:
To solve this problem, we need to calculate the perimeter of the rectangle (fence) which is given by the formula P=2*(length + Breadth). But we must remember that James doesn't want to hang any streamers on the tree. So we don't need to subtract anything from the total length of crepe paper needed because the tree doesn't affect the fence perimeter.

Steps:

1. Calculate the total length which is 2*(20 ft + 15 ft)
2. The amount of crepe paper James needs is the same as the total length calculated in step 1.

history.name: Agent_Code_Executor
history.content:
# I will use Python to calculate the total length of crepe paper James needs to buy.

# Step 1: I will define the dimensions of the rectangular fence.
length = 20 # in feet
breadth = 15 # in feet

# Step 2: I'll calculate the total length (i.e., the perimeter) using the formula P = 2*(length + breadth)
total_length = 2 * (length + breadth) # in feet

# Now I'll print the result.
print(total_length)

history.name: Agent_Verifier
history.content:
The code provided by the Agent Code Executor would result in 70 which is correct based on the calculation from Agent Problem Solver as well. Hence we can conclude James needs to buy 70 feet of crepe paper for his fence.

SOLUTION_FOUND: 70.
